author: yperbasis
content: Isn't trusted setup required for KZG/Kate commitments a big issue? Wouldn't bulletproof commitments be preferable for the Verkle tree?

author: .vbuterin
content: We're increasingly looking at bulletproofs actually

author: .vbuterin
content: The main impetus was not so much the trusted setup (a trusted setup of size 256 can easily be scaled to many thousands of participants, so we don't need to worry much about it)

author: .vbuterin
content: EC operation efficiency (looks like it can be much faster on non-pairing-friendly curves), and also data efficiency (32 byte commitments instead of 48 byte)
